author: {'steamid': '76561198348006531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1675971771}
review:
Un jeu excellent ! Le gameplay est incroyable, les graphismes sont sublimes et les musiques entraînantes ! Le jeu est plutôt facile à prendre en mains mais difficile à contrôler parfaitement ! Comme on dit "Easy To Learn, Hard To Master" ! Les mécaniques sont bien pensées mais par moment le jeu fait des micros freeze et donc, peut ruiner un match au vue du gameplay rapide et très agressif de celui-ci ! Le jeu est vraiment trop bien et j'y ais même amener mes amis dessus !

L'un des problèmes que je voudrais soulever également, c'est le niveau de difficulté de l'IA. En effet du niveau 1 à 6 l'IA est pas très forte mais dès que l'on augmente juste de 1 niveau, je trouve l'IA imbattable car spam instantanément 2 projectiles quand la balle atteins son mur de protection... J'imagine que je ne suis pas non plus le meilleur joueur mais j'ai tout de même un niveau plutôt bon.

D'autres petit bug d'affichage arrive quand on modifie le skin d'un personnage. celui-ci ne s'affiche pas directement au prochain match mais seulement après 4 ou 5 ! Et je trouve ça dommage car ce n'est pas uniquement le skin !mais aussi le cadre de joueur ou encore l'image de profile.

Pour donner un avis générale sur le jeu, je trouve le jeu très amusant et plaisant à jouer mais le manque de contenue depuis le début du jeu est selon moi la raison pour laquelle le jeu n'a pas durée... Et c'est vraiment dommage car le jeu a un potentiel incroyable ! que ce sois au niveau casual ou bien à plus haut niveau ! 

J’espère au moins que les développeurs liront ce message car j'aimerai vraiment que le jeu grandisse et devienne plus connu ! Je continuerai de jouer en espérant rencontrer de nouveaux joueurs en ligne !
developer_response:
Bonjour et merci pour la review complète et la remontée de bugs !

Bien que le jeu soit peu actif sur Steam / seul, la communauté subsiste sur Discord où les gens se donnent rendez-vous pour des bastons à l'improviste.

Nous sommes aussi présent sur les salons TGS en France (pour l'instant).

Il y a d'autres facteurs qui font qu'un jeu ne "marche pas" et c'est compliqué de créer une communauté assez grosse et régulière pour porter un jeu gratuit. Cependant nous ne laissons pas tomber Exoblast et continuons à le maintenir en espérant réussir à fédérer une communauté plus grande au fil du temps.

Merci encore pour la review, à bientôt !

review:
Do not buy this if you are in Asia.
First, they put detailed explanation about game system between gibberish dialogue. So when I missed that by pressing space. it's gone. there's no game manual, in game explanation, run tutorial all over button whatsoever in game, Hell. I am even validated game file to reset game. and that so called 'big ball' is so unclear I couldn't figured out what that big ball do. 
you don't have to explain to me, cause I am pretty sure gonna delete this game after I finish writing this.
Second. game provide 3 servers that EU, NA, SA. which their ping follows 270, 270, 323.
Yeah, I know. I am not complaining about non-playable environment caused by lagging on human versus mod.
I am talking about computer bot match mod. after tutorial failed to deliver its intended function and pissed me off. I tried ai-versus mod which is only unlocked. and bloody hell. it is lagging more than russian server. and most importantly what piss me off is those lags are server side based lag, not the client side lagging. your entire key input is send to their server first, processed, send back to you, and THEN it applied to your client. As a final result what you see on screen is enemy is moving smoothly on time while every your movement is lagged 1 second after you pressed the key.  
there you goes, the game that even playing with bot is unplayable is complete.
Game's bgm is somewhat nice to listen while I am writing this.

author: {'steamid': '76561199125395547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1650213003}
review:
A game I wanna love but lots of things holding it back.

The game is one of those simple to play, hard to master. Based on Ping Pong it must be pretty simple right? Wrong. Instead of being able to hit the Pong with only the stick it now has to be hit by being blasted by power blast from your ship. It has borders to stop the blast from the other player but not completely. With the addition of characters, different ships which changes the type of powers you use, how big your blast is, if you have shields, how long it takes to charge etc.

So, now that the basic's is out the way how does it feel to play? Very smoothly when its not lagging. You can play local, VS AI, Online or Ranked Online. In the start your going to play VS AI since the online is locked behind lvls. Playing vs the AI is odd for one major reason...IT FREAKING LAGS AND IS ONLINE? Why does playing against AI make you lag so bad to where you can't even move up or down? I suggest changing this ASAP cause its very obnoxious in the middle of a heated exchange. Moving on the online its sad cause from what I saw this game is DEAD. The player base while writing this is sadly very small to the point where it took me 40 minutes to look for a single match in which I gave up at that point.  Also while I was training and waiting for a match it was NOT LAGGING AT ALL. Whatever you did for that you should do for the AI matches.

Conclusion: The gameplay while the best part of this game is heavily held back by the lack of a player base most likely due too the constant lagging in a match which stops you from moving in your tracks.
Gameplay: 5/5 (Simple but really fun gameplay)
Graphics: 4/5 (Great art style on really high graphics) 
Soundtrack: 1/5 (Got annoying very quickly)
Online: 0/5 (Dead player base due to constant lag)
Total: 2/5 (Has potential if the lag is fixed, which may bring a stable player base)

Will be looking forward to any updates if the lag is fixed until then I DO not recommend this game.

review:
슈팅 핑퐁게임

좌우에 우주선이 존재하며 좌측에 있는게 플레이어 우주선입니다.
우주선은 상하로 움직이면서 둥근 에너지를 모아서 쏠 수 있으며,
이를 통해 공을 쳐내어 상대측에 보내고 골인시키면 점수를 얻을 수 있습니다.

에너지는 차징방식이며 얼마나 많은 에너지를 모아서 쏘느냐에 따라서 공에게 가해지는 힘도 달라지며
이를 되받아지는 적도 그에 상승하는 에너지를 모아서 쏘아야 정상적으로 쳐낼 수 있죠.
물론, 짧게짧게 빠르게 쏘아내는 것도 가능합니다.

조심해야할 것은 역시 공.
공이 우주선의 뒤로 넘어가게 되면 점수를 빼앗기게 되며
이 공에 우주선이 닿게 되면 체력이 감소하고 모두 잃으면 펑하고 터지게 됩니다.
상대가 이때 실수를 하지 않는 이상 반드시 점수를 잃게 되는 상황이 발생하죠.

게임을 진행하면서 경험치를 얻어 레벨업이 가능하며
레벨에 따라서 새로운 우주선이 언락되어 플레이가능하기도 합니다.
우주선마다 조금씩 스텟이 다르죠,

아쉬운 점
-AI랑 플레이하는 것임에도 딜레이가 있어서 툭툭 끊기는 느낌이 들고 매끄럽지 않음

author: {'steamid': '76561198003352401', 'num_games_owned': 1224, 'num_reviews': 384, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1646239610}
review:
Tout le monde connait Pong, je ne pense pas qu'il y ait besoin de rappeler le principe du jeu, mais que se passerait-il si au lieu d'une simple barre verticale le joueur dirigeait un pilote dans un mecha pouvant tirer des projectiles pour repousser la balle ? C'est ce que propose Exoblast, le premier jeu du studio français Dreamirl.

Seuls trois boutons sont utilisés : haut, bas et tir. Simple, efficace et dès les premiers échanges on est séduit par le dynamisme du jeu. L'idée de devoir renvoyer la balle en tirant dessus fonctionne parfaitement et très rapidement on commence à anticiper ses rebonds et à charger ses projectiles pour la propulser plus rapidement vers son adversaire. Dès que la balle touche le mur adverse le joueur récupère un point, le premier qui en obtient trois gagne le set.

Le choix du pilote et du méca n'est pas anodin. Les trois héros possèdent des capacités passives spécifiques (vitesse des projectiles augmentée lorsque la balle se trouve dans la moitié adverse, cadence de tir augmentée quand le robot n'a plus de bouclier, vitesse de déplacement augmentée après avoir perdu un bouclier, etc.). Les six mécas ont quant à eux des statistiques différentes (puissance, nombre de boucliers, points de vie, vitesse des projectiles...). À vous de tester les différentes combinaisons pour trouver ce qui vous correspond le mieux.

Au fil des parties, on découvre peu à peu de nombreuses subtilités comme la possibilité de détruire son adversaire. Chaque contact direct avec la balle fait perdre un point de bouclier au robot. S'il n'a plus de bouclier ce sont directement les points de vie qui sont attaqués et s'ils tombent à zéro il explose et le "but" est vide. Chose très intéressante également, renvoyer la balle juste après avoir perdu un bouclier provoque une attaque smash très puissante.

Au niveau des modes de jeu c'est du très classique avec la possibilité de jouer en local (contre l'ia ou contre un deuxième joueur) ainsi qu'en ligne en mode classé ou non. Les serveurs sont malheureusement pour le moment assez vides et vous retomberez souvent sur les mêmes adversaires.

J'ai lancé Exoblast en me disant qu'il pourrait me plaire mais c'est bien plus que ça... j'ai adoré ! Les échanges sont intenses, intéressants, les combinaisons pilote/robot permettent de changer son approche du jeu et il y a un très bon sentiment de progression. On commence à anticiper ses tirs, à les décaler, à essayer de taper la balle de côté pour esquiver une grosse attaque adverse, etc. L'ambiance est d'ailleurs très réussie avec une excellente bande-son et pas mal de petites animations renforçant le dynamisme général. Cerise sur le gâteau, Exoblast est gratuit, vous devez l'essayer !

review:
Fun pong-style PVP or AI battles, decently thought out mechanics, great art & style, and it's literally free. 
Give it a try.

That said, input lag (but is actually server side movement, not input lag) (even on US servers close to me) isn't acceptable for a competitive game - and that's not the fault of the ping itself. The way the netcode is done (from what I can gather), means that you see the game as what server side says it is, when in every major competitive game right now, your own perspective is determined client side: it's literally the only way to make netcode that feels playable. Even at something like 50 ping, you're visually waiting 100ms before you see your ship move. The total effect of this problem? You must input in advance of what you think will happen, else you're playing 100-150ms behind (situationally). The current system for netcode is literally impossible to make competitive or acceptable imo - there must be a change to client side movement & something like rollback netcode, or there will always feel like there's delay

TL/DR -Online matchmaking has very few players
           -Online matchmaking has connection issues with input delay
           -Ranked mode has people picking the same pilot and ship because its the best one

           -Keep in mind its a free to play game as well as fairly new the writing of this post so if

review:
[h1] Мне хватило 40-ка минут для того, чтобы у меня закружилась голова от всех этих неоновых вспышек [/h1]

Честно, игра хороша. Особенно понравилось музыкальное сопровождение. Не думаю, что уже была концепция неона, кибер-панка и пинг-понга. Однако долго играть в эту игру у меня не вышло. Как я уже сказал - закружилась голова от вспышек, ибо я играл ещё в наушниках. Слишком много белых цветов, наверное слишком быстрый для меня геймплей, хотя я не думаю, что пинг-понг должен быть медленным. Отбиваем мы кстати говоря пинг-понговый шарик генерируемыми волнами своего летательного аппарата - нажатием на пробел, а двигаемся на W и S. Не самая лучшая комбинация кнопок, так как игра подразумевает чаще пользоваться пробелом. В итоге получается, что после после продолжительной игры мой большой палец который тыкал на пробел так быстро как мог - загнулся. Быстро устают пальцы, ибо постоянно жмешь одну кнопку под не удобным углом. По итогу скажу - вечерком можно засесть, но не на долго. Не думаю, что вы проведёте в игре очень много часов, так как контента в ней пока не так уж и много. Дать второй шанс игре можно - что я и сделаю. Учту, что игра родилась буквально неделю назад, и думаю ей можно простить половину, потому поставлю палец вверх :3

review:
When i saw the trailer for the game i thought that ships and characters are purely for cosmetical purposes and when i noticed the whole part where each character has a certian perk and purpose i was put off since eventually there's going to be a meta of one character simply being better. 

When i choose characters i choose them from their looks and design not because of how easy or good they are and i think many people who play the game for the first time do the same, when i noticed that the squid looking ship isnt the fastest and some more heavy cargo looking one was faster i was kinda put off cause the design looked like the opposite 

This might sounds stupid and probably not possible (who knows) but i was thinking of maybe the possibility of adding some kind of "classic" mode where the premise of the game stands the same but the ships dont have health and everyone's even (same stats same speed everything) and the character you choose same with the ship is purely a cosmetic change.
However i can understand that this is simply a 1 person and the dev team has enough on it's plate already.

My review is not negative if steam had a mixed option i would've chosen that. This game definetly has a charm and i like the idea it's just that clearly the game is more set for a competetive community and i am afraid of the imbalance that could happen in the future (especially if the dev team makes more characters and ships for the game)

[spoiler] [u] A lot of games have a "tons" of stats today and just do fine (or they don't show stats lol). [/u] 
Doesnt mean that you should follow them for a simple game like this. [/spoiler]
developer_response:
Hello,

I understand your review and indeed the game is pretty cool playing "mirror matches", that's a personnal feeling and the game was originally designed that way.

But as this was ok for the prototype, it would have been "not enough" the long run. Maybe if the game was just a "local" at 4 or 5$.

From our perspective, competitive players want different things, and there are indeed some meta and balance change here and there (so far the community love that).

Offering a "All the same" mode is a good idea and could be added, but I'm afraid people wouldn't understand the difference. I guess the best for you is to play mirror games with friends in the Local Mode (offline), it should work great with what you say I guess (just grab Nisha she doesn't have skills that change a lot what's happening, unlike Kalak).

Hope you'll have some cool vibes on it if you have a chance to play it with friends.

review:
This game takes the basic aspects of a air hockey or pong game and turns them into a more action packed game of strategy and skill, leaving it closer to something like Lethal League. If you're looking for a high paced game of rallies or just something fun to pass a few minutes away, I highly recommend checking it out. If nothing else, it only takes a couple mins to download and a couple more to try. 

Pros: 
- Short game times (2-5 mins)
- Fast que times
- High intensity
- Fast learning curve, high skill ceiling
- Customizable to suit your playstyle 
- Excellent and fitting music
- Active developers
- Competitive or casual play options
- Bright but not distracting animation
- Local and private matches available

Cons:
- Lack of tutorial
- Matchmaking balance*

*You're going to go against people who've played before, some who are very skilled. Try to emulate their actions and focus on improvement before giving up after a few losses. The controls are simple enough that you're only limited by your patience to adapt and learn. 

Many complaints I've seen address finding a match or the game being confusing. The player base for this game is currently growing, but despite this, I've personally had no problems finding a game within a few seconds. All the mechanics of the game are shown, although they are not stated in a tutorial. Here are some basic mechanics of the game to alleviate confusion:

Game mechanics:
- Controls: Move up/down and fire (Keyboard: Arrow keys and Spacebar, Controller: Left stick and A). You can hold fire for a stronger shot, strength and charge speed are dependent on ship and pilot. 
- Objective: Get the ball through the opposite goal
- Scoring: Each round is first to 3 points, first to two rounds wins (in casual, in competitive it's first to 3). Mid-round points are shown center screen, round points are shown at the top.
- Shield: If you're hit by the ball at a fast enough speed, you'll lose 1 shield charge. Shields can regenerate, unlike health.  (Shield icons are located next to your character showing how many you have left, as well as a representation of your shield strength around your character)
- Health: If you have no shields, you will take health damage. Run out of this and you'll be destroyed, unable to defend your  goal. (Health is shown at the top of the screen)
- Ball speed: When the ball is hit by larger shots, it moves faster. Faster balls hit shields and health harder.

Summary:
This game is a fast paced, easy to learn, high skill ceiling game that you can use to fill a few mins or a several hours as casually or competitively as you like. 
I hope this review convinced you to try the game for yourself, and I'll to see you in the tower.

review:
Fun little game. It's a simple premise and doesn't let number crunching or side things get in the way of letting the core gameplay shine.  

I wish some of the stats were more explicitly explained so you can have an easier time finding the character and ship that fit best for your style.  That said, you get the general feel of things with a few rounds against a bot. Including a brief cheat-sheet detailing the mechanics and stats somewhere in the menu would be an easy fix.  

Where the game really excels is presentation.  It's got style.  The art, music and even the scoreboard and other HUD elements really contribute to the experience and those little things are what can set a game apart. 

Hopefully it gets a bigger player base, the price is certainly hard to argue with and potato rigs aren't a limiter either.  I look forward to trying to suck in a few friends. Give it a go.

review:
アップデートで簡易的なチュートリアルが追加されました！
ゲームシステムと操作方法、自機の弾とパックの仕様が主な内容です。難しいことはほとんどないので、無料ですしせっかくなら触れてみてはいかがでしょうか？

さらに追記:チュートリアルを見かけなかったから(現在は簡易的なものがあります)私見で書き込むね。参考になるといいな。（何か間違ってたら指摘も欲しいな)

上下の移動入力と弾をチャージ/発射するキーの3ボダンのみ（コンフィグ参照）
パックに弾を当てることで動力になる。
- チャージすると機体ごとに設定された最大パワーに応じて巨大化。
- パックに当てると一段階下がった状態で即リチャージされる。この時リチャージされた弾は、チャージ/発射キーを押さなければそのまま保たれる。
ラリーをするとコンボボーナスが入るけど、パイロットのスキルチャージになってるのかな？
機体にはシールド値があり、その数字分だけ機体をパック衝突のダメージから防いでくれる。
- シールドが無くなった時はHPで受けることになり、０になると自機が大破する。
- ダメージの数値はパックの移動速度に応じて変化する
- 自機が大破しても試合は続くので油断すると得点を許してしまうことになるのでしっかりパックを処理しましょう
フィールドの端でパックを抱えて撃つと凄いスピードで飛んでくことが有るけど、私には条件が分からないんだよね。
弾を幾ら乱射してもパック衝突でしかダメージは受けないから某サイヤ人の王子の信用ならないグミ撃ちにしかならないよ。

追記:discordにて、ラグが辛い時のAI練習で有益な情報をいただきました！
- アジアでのサーバー構築はロードマップの中にあります。 
- ATMでラグなくプレイするための唯一のアドバイスは、AIを相手にする "ローカルモード "を使うことです（レベル、船、パイロットを選択できます）
これでゲームそのものはしっかりと楽しめますね。サーバー追加は首を長くしてお待ちしております！

asiaサーバーがないのでラグが辛いくらいでゲームは良きものだぁ..。
エアホッケーにシューティングのような要素が加わってるので、東京フレンドパークのホンジャマカ戦並みに盤面を広く使えます...インチキした時並みの幅が使えます。が、パックに動力を伝えるのは弾を当てなければなりません。
直感的な操作のエアホッケーとは違って、偏差撃ちをしたり角度を付けられる位置に撃ったりと自機の位置を気にしなければならないのは、さながらシューティングゲームのようにも思えます。自機は体力性なのでデザインは本当にシューティングゲーム寄りっぽいですよね。複数の機体とパイロットからそれぞれ一つを選べるので、自分に合ったプレイングが見つかるといいですね。
オンラインで遊べてないので事細かに書けないのが残念ですが、楽しいゲームなのは間違いない。←300msでもオンラインで点が取れるようになってきました！500+msでノーラグに勝つ猛者がいるみたいで、その強さには憧れますね

Pong do seculo XXI. Gostei :)
Perfeito para matar o tempo com partidas rápidas, alem de ter seu lado competitivo online também. ;)
Conta com partidas de "treino" contra a IA e a opção de jogar online, com ranking de jogadores aparentemente.

Alguns detalhes:

[b]Visual:[/b]
Bela pixel art, do jeito que nossa memoria afetiva dos 8 e 16 bits lembra. <3

[b]Áudio:[/b]
Trilha sonora de LukHash que combina muito bem com a ambientação do game, além dos efeitos típicos de 8 bits. Bem nostálgico ;)

[b]Gameplay:[/b]
Quem já jogou ou ouviu falar de Pong sabe do que se trata :D
O diferencial esta na dinâmica de shooter incorporada que deixa a partida mais frenética e divertida.

Ainda é um jogo em desenvolvimento e, provavelmente, daí vem a única questão negativa que vou mencionar abaixo:

[b]Os servidores:[/b]
Ate o momento desta analise apenas Europa e America do Norte disponíveis; ou seja, seu ping aqui no BR vai ser alto (não consegui menos de 400 nas minhas tentativas o.O ), e num jogo onde os reflexos e velocidade de resposta são mais que necessários (alem da Player skill), fica impraticável jogar assim infelizmente.

[b]Edit:[/b] Os devs anunciaram a possibilidade de um server BR para America do Sul e um para Asia em local a definir, assim esse ponto negativo pode deixar de ser relevante daqui a algum tempo. ;)

Certamente essas questões serão resolvidas ao longo do desenvolvimento do jogo, por isso seria injusto dar uma recomendação negativa nesse momento. Vale a pena sim ter o game em sua biblioteca e acompanhar o desenvolvimento nas plataformas e comunidades dos devs (inclusive eles incentivam os jogadores a participarem).

Enfim, um bom jogo que merece sua atenção e paciência. o/

author: {'steamid': '76561198194680793', 'num_games_owned': 3045, 'num_reviews': 1947, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1637143882}
review:
Довольно неплохая вариация понга, выполненная в неоновом стиле. Играете не досками, и отбиваете не ими. Механика геймплея в другом. Вы управляете, как и ваш соперник, футуристическими пушками, которые стреляют энергетическими шарами. В центре поля появляется белый энергетический шар, который нужно толкать своими выстрелами. Цель одержать в матче 10 побед. Одержать победу можно двумя путями. Первый, это забить белый шар противнику. Второе, это уничтожить самого противника, попав по нему белым шаром три раза. Выстрелы у пушек бесконечны. Можете непрерывно стрелять, а можете потратить несколько секунд на заряд более мощного выстрела, который, соответственно, сильнее толкнёт белый шар. Если повезёт, можете сразу две победы одержать, сначала разбив пушку противнику, а потом ещё и забив шар в пустующие ворота. Перед каждым противником находится энергетический щит, о который разбиваются выстрелы противника. Так что просто обстрелять друг друга не получится. Поверьте, геймплей цепляет, вызывая азарт к победе.

Естественно, игра заточена под мультиплеерные баталии. Но, к сожалению, онлайн мёртв. По дефолту вы противника себе не найдёте. На этот случай есть дискорд-сообщество (появляется при запуске игры), так что думаю найти противника себе можно. Как минимум, позвав друга, ведь игра бесплатная и ему не придётся её покупать.

В общем, довольно интересная игра, способная затянуть не на один час. Главное, чтобы было с кем играть. Мне с ботом то нехило так игра увлекла. Что уже говорить о живом противнике. Есть статистика и игра находится в раннем доступе. Возможно, разработчик добавит ещё что-то.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112883216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1704924605}
review:
I played this game occasionally online with my friends and i found it to be very competitive. There were still some things to tweak and some lag to adjust. For example it lacked fluidity in the movement and i found no way to exit the game if not pressing x after alt plus enter. 
The recent update was shocking because the game losts its already precarious fluidity completely.
The shield is always on and cannot be broken anymore. 
Now i'll say some subjective opinions. Personally i preferred the old design, it was more clear in what was possible to do and what not, and by the look of a ship it was easier to get what they actually do.
One more specific opinion is the fact that this game is more about the match itself than the preparation, i already found it odd that you can upgrade a ship in the older version before a match, since we didn't want to have an unfair match we didn't upgrade any ship for making it less confusing. 
So in this game i don't find it necessary to have a campaign or anything like that, it has a feel of an old lan game party or like an hair hockey match. So a match should be always be balanced.
I hope this review wasn't too harsh, it appears that lots of works was put in this new update and i still find that the basic concept behind it is a smart way to make a simp,e pong much more competitive.
I hope it will get better.
developer_response:
How did I mess this review? Shame on me.

Anyway thanks for this review it is very clear and understandable.
We had some huge bugs on the 0.3 on release and maybe you noticed most of them have been fixed.

About the online feeling, it is because we changed how the algorythm work because previously: if you had the feeling of being smooth, the reality was different and your real position was probably somewhere else (because of the lag) this made some very weird feeling for players with a bad connection and we decided to move to this new sync system, like most of the games.

It is maybe more laggy (as feeling) but also more realistic (about time I mean).

Also we added a server in USA so make sure to uncheck servers you don't want to play on from the settings menu (there is also the ping displayed in game now).


About the readability of ships, we think that it will takes some times to players to know each modules and being able to read what the opponent get and do.

About the balance it is harder to do with this system, but we think in the long term it will bring more freedom in the gameplay of each players.

Ah final point, if you are not on the discord feel free to join it, it is faster/easier to talk with us and give us feedback like that, about how we can improve things and fix bugs faster.

Thanks for the time and the feedback, hopefully you will think it is better in the coming update and this review will go from bad to good 😊

review:
Bem vamos ao que interessa!
- Jogabilidade 8/10 - Jogabilidade bem simples fácil de aprender e difícil de dominar!
- Gráficos 9/10 - Lembrando que é um jogo pixelado, por tanto o gráfico é bem feito desde modelos até cores!
- História 1/10 - Não possuí nenhuma história, apenas jogue e vença!
- Microtransação: - Parece possuir uma moeda extra e algo relativo a premium, espero que não seja mais um jogo mercenário!
- Trilha sonora: 5/10 - É legal as musiquinhas tem uma pegada eletrônica, mas se tornam muito repetitivas!
- conteúdo: 4/10 - Possuí poucas naves e desbalanceadas ainda sendo melhor a nave padrão, poucas skins com preços absurdos, Poucos personagens jogáveis e muito pobre em cenário, pois sempre joga no mesmo
- Multijogador: 2/10 - Todas as partidas que joguei foi contra o AI, pois não se acha jogadores, pelo menos o multijogador funciona!
- Suporte pra controle: 9/10 - não percebi nenhum bug grave ou algo que atrapalhe a jogabilidade é bem simples de aprender!
Depois desses tópicos vale a pena joga-lo?
Faz um teste vai que gosta!

Bem no máximo 2 ou 3 horas esse jogo vai propor diversão principalmente com amigos já que contra bots enjoa rápido, a AI é inteligente e propõe um desafio, antes de decorar todos seus movimentos é claro;
Tem potencial vale a pena conferir, porém essa diversão durará pouco pois se torna muito repetitivo;

review:
I download every single free-to-play, freemium, demo, and even some occasionally buy-to-play and subscription based MMOs I come across on Steam. This title, despite being in early testing, is one of the most enjoyable I've come across in the past few months. The controls are responsive, the ball physics are mostly spot-on, and it is one of the few iterations of Pong that changes the game in a way that adds new challenge to an old concept while not breaking it or just adding extra gimmicks. The AI difficulty ranges from lousy to a decent challenge and the playerbase -- albeit small -- is full of great people. No obvious pay-to-win items either. The artstyle is simplistic yet quite visually appealing. The music fits perfectly and is listenable outside of the game on it's own merit.

Highly recommended if you enjoy classic games, want a multiplayer game that isn't resource intensive, and don't want to be forced to grind for days on end in a multiplayer game just to be competitive. Skill wins out in this title but even when losing, it's still a blast.

review: Absolutely horrible. I don't know how you butcher such a simple concept so badly. This is pong, yet somehow the controls are confusing. The tutorial says hold down the shoot button to charge a shot, but after that my ship just starts charging and shooting random shots independent of my controller inputs. I'm assuming there are some kind of game mechanics that are at work but they don't explain anything so I have no idea what's happening. It could just be the lag because for some reason the game responds to controller input really slowly so maybe my shots are just so far behind the actual button presses that it's creating a complete disconnect between my inputs and the actual action. The only other player in the game has a firm grasp on it however so he keeps beating the ever loving crap out of me. This game concept was already perfected 50 years ago, all you had to do was put a coat of polish on it and market it with a basic level of competence. How you screw that up is beyond me.
developer_response:
Hello OldCyrus,

From what we read it looks like it's more because of the lag than inputs, so far we didn't get any feedback of players that have troubles with inputs (excepted lags for some Japanese and Russian players).

Also you might have fought against me (or a mate), or an other player that is really good at it and I understand your complete frustration, that's normal and we do apologize for the few players that are playing actually.

If whenever you would give the game a second chance, you should try playing in "Local mode" against a level 6 AI (which is pretty good) and also custom mode against a friend.

Also please let us know the country you are from, we need this kind of information to know where we should add more servers.

It will be with pleasure to help you and hopefully, give you a positive experience (that's our goal), you know where to catch us, it's on you 👌

review:
interesting technical challenge. 

the game is not revolutionary by any means, yet the technical part of it is something worth looking into. 
It is full javascript, which means the game can be loaded in seconds and if for some bug or unforeseen trouble, the servers crashes, it took only seconds to restart everything. 

it still needs polish here and there, the interface for example is still work in progress.
the music is fine, not too repetitive, for me at least.

I wonder if more moves could be added down the line, a la "windjammers" otherwise the game loop is rather short.
Overall it has the same strength and weaknesses as a game of puck, it is fine for a few games but finding more depth will be a challenge. I'm looking forward to seeing how they manage that issue. I would recommend it 100% for the technical interest and for a short session of virtual puck.
